attributes.action: Lack of options when viewing 3D cinema uk
attributes.additional_details:
At the moment, a large portion of cinemas are offering a very limited choice when it comes to watching a film in 2D. Not only is 2D still very popular with a sizable portion of the cinema going public in the UK, there are also a sizable amount of people who don't want to pay the price of a "premium" ticket, in order to see a film in a format they do not want to see. Also, there are a lot of people who hare visually imparied, who are physically unable to watch films in 3D.
I would like the governemt to step in, and stop this monopoly of the local multiplexes forcing people to pay higher prices at the cinema, to see a film in a format that they do not want to see.
